website_summaries.verdict: A thicker-than-average tree wrap that protects tree bark nicely but doesn't cover a lot of area.
pros: Wrap is flexible enough to allow the tree to grow naturally while it remains in place
Protects tree bark from insects and rodents
Allows water and air to pass through, yet it still provides a high level of protection from various threats

customer_reviews.title: and it will be good for at least one more winter
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tree wrap before. I have used the same wrap for two winters, and it will be good for at least one more winter. I use it to prevent sun scald during the winter on smooth bark trees. I have quite a bit of bark damage on the south side of my trees because I didn't use this product when I first planted the trees because no one told me I was supposed to wrap them for winter.
customer_reviews.author: DABBLER

customer_reviews.title: works well on young citrus trees
customer_reviews.text: a very good product. i have been using it on my young citrus trees for just under a year on my citrus trees. i took off the wrap today and my trees trunks look amazing. i think it is better then the old style of using tree paint. i will continue to use it for my citrus trees, and i am going to try to get my dad to use this over tree paint.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D

customer_reviews.title: This wasn't at all what it sounded like in the description - probably my fault - but ...
customer_reviews.text: This wasn't at all what it sounded like in the description - probably my fault - but it's more like a bandage than a protection. I'll find someone around here who might be able to use it as it's not worth sending back. As others have commented - it doesn't stick to itself or the tree - you have to use string or the like to secure the "wrap"....otherwise, it simply unwinds and flops to the ground. Also - it's not very flexible - so it doesn't conform to the tree like I thought it would.
customer_reviews.author: Thornns

customer_reviews.title: This stuff does not stick to itself at all! ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff does not stick to itself at all! May it very difficult to apply to my tree trunks. I have small citrus trees with bumpy irregular bark. I had to use twine to tie it on so that it would stay. We can launch a Tesla car to Mars but nobody can make a tree wrap that will stick to itself?? Gee Whiz🙁
customer_reviews.author: Keeter

customer_reviews.title: I defiantly recommend this, Jobe's Tree Wrap
customer_reviews.text: worked very well. kept the deer from damaging our young dogwood any more than they already had. wish I would have know about this tree wrap sooner. I defiantly recommend this, Jobe's Tree Wrap
customer_reviews.author: Denise Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Good for one season only and does not stick
customer_reviews.text: This only lasted one season. So much for the claim it stretches as the tree grows. It does not stick to the tree. Three stars because I at least got one season out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Anne MarieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nicer kind for your fragile trees
customer_reviews.text: Worked much better than the inflexible plastic covers I have previously used... Our trees are between sizes and I scraped the fragile maple tree bark last year with the crappy hard plastic kind. Not this year! These are flexible and soft to the touch. Holding up well to the rigors of winter :)
customer_reviews.author: Cleaning Machine

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This wrap seems to be durable and resistant to bug and critters. I wrapped a newly planted peach tree last spring, and it's still intact now, almost a year later. It's easy to use and I would recommend it to anyone trying to prevent damage to newly planted trees. The tree's also doing well, so it does not damage the tree in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Not sure of usefulness
customer_reviews.text: If you have a new or tiny tree, this may work. I got 3 wraps around my tree. Didn't do much. Won't help the tree. I'll draw on it to make a happy face for the grands like I do their band aids but this would take about 50 rolls to maybe help. Also won't stick to itself or tree.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri L. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply and it does the job.
customer_reviews.text: It works. The wrap was easy to apply to the slim trunk of my crape myrtle tree because it clings softly to itself. My cat had been scratching on the trunk, but the wrap stopped her immediately.
customer_reviews.author: J. Blumberg

customer_reviews.title: It was a quick and very effective fix for the ...
customer_reviews.text: It was a quick and very effective fix for the problem of protecting the young, still growing, tree trunks of our three citrus fruit trees..
customer_reviews.author: S. R. Woody

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well this year and held up great. Did a good job protecting the tress from ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well this year and held up great. Did a good job protecting the tress from frost. We did not have as much damage to the trees as we did last year.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: You don't get much
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable price if you got 4 times what they give you
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: Keep the Deer at Bay
customer_reviews.text: I needed to keep the deer from rubbing the bark off a young tree and this does the job. It's somewhat elastic so it stays up on its own and will "give" as the tree grows. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Peter B

customer_reviews.title: Great tree warp.  Need for MN winters.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Used in on our River Birch. Recommended by the tree farm where we bought our tree.
customer_reviews.author: MN Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Prevent Sunscald
customer_reviews.text: Very nice wrap and perfect for what I needed. I have a new tree that does not have enough branches or leaves to shield the trunk from the temperature variations as it gets colder. This does the job.
customer_reviews.author: franksj

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Got rid of the ant problem under the bark. Works quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Hulse

customer_reviews.title: tree wrap
customer_reviews.text: Got this to wrap around some new small trees we planted. I like it alot, it stays wrapped around but I think I would like it better if it were green or brown so you can't see a large white thing wrapped around the base of a tree. Other than color though I like it
customer_reviews.author: Deneen M. Lotz

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Met expectations. This tape is not adhesive (I knew that when I bought it) so I used electrical tape to secure top and bottoms.
customer_reviews.author: Doug, Macungie PA

customer_reviews.title: Ends were faded brown and looked horrible once the paper wrap was removed
customer_reviews.text: Ends were faded brown and looked horrible once the paper wrap was removed. Amazon shipped a second and it was the same.
customer_reviews.author: J.Brown

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: Wrapped a 3” maple. Took the entire roll to wrap the tree from ground to 4’. I expected it would use it all. Just applied it last fall so will see how it lasts. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: K. Karpinski

customer_reviews.title: very easy to put
customer_reviews.text: Wrapped my tree with this, very easy to put on
customer_reviews.author: Nanc Finn

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Young Trees With This
customer_reviews.text: Great product to protect young trees during the winter. Easy to use. It stays on the tree trunks all winter. If stored it should be reusable for several years.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Jane

customer_reviews.title: Provides good coverage
customer_reviews.text: This wrap was easy to install and provides good coverage. I'm not sure how well this wrap will prevent rodents from chewing bark at the base of the tree so I may add another wrap (foil containing) over the base of the tree to better deter rodents.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well on application, will see what spring brings and how it holds up
customer_reviews.author: Iolanthe

customer_reviews.title: That's A Wrap!
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, I used it to protect the trunk of a Mandarin Orange tree from sun scorch. It wears very well
customer_reviews.author: Mark G.

customer_reviews.title: Jobe's 5230P Tree Protection Wrap - 4-Inch x 20-Foot  - LOVE LOVE THESE!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you Amazon - I couldn't find these anywhere - I have used them before and needed them again! The Jobe's 5230P Tree Protection Wrap - 4-Inch x 20-Foot are great for my trees!
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply.
customer_reviews.text: Application was easy enough but the true test won’t be known until spring/summer as the seasons change.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Zimmer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: it works well. We used it for a new tree, very small and it recovered quickly
customer_reviews.author: M. Colombo

customer_reviews.title: Good small tree protection
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on our small trees. Was easy to apply.
customer_reviews.author: E. B. Marsolais

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great stretchy wrap to protect tree trunk. I may have to let you know after the winter is over to see if it keeps the animals from chewing the trunk but so far it seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Buying Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to wrap around my young Sunset Maple and Weeping Willow trees for the upcoming winter season. Hoping it prevents winter sunscald.
customer_reviews.author: Largo

customer_reviews.title: Buying Again
customer_reviews.text: This was my second time purchasing this tree wrap & it works great! I am once again very happy with the product!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wrapped one tree and liked it because I was able to stretch it and ...
customer_reviews.text: I wrapped one tree and liked it because I was able to stretch it and make it fit to the contur of the tree.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Conner

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: We used this to wrap a young tree and protect it from rodents eating the bark. Worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Mann

customer_reviews.title: Very Good but a little hard to tie up on my ...
customer_reviews.text: Very Good but a little hard to tie up on my specific tree. The tree does not have a very smooth surface but I got it to work. The squirrels love to use it as a ladder but a small stuffed cat at the tree base works real good.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Malmgren

customer_reviews.title: Jobe's Tree wrap
customer_reviews.text: I have used this in the past, and it works great. I do pull it a little tight as I am wrapping it around and moving downward, and at the end I use a pair of scissors and cut back inward in the center and tie it in a knot so it doesn't come off. I have read that some people use straight pins also.
customer_reviews.author: Terri T.

customer_reviews.title: I expected more. It barely made it's way around ...
customer_reviews.text: I expected more. It barely made it's way around a small diameter tree. It's just OK, nothing more nothing less.
customer_reviews.author: philip brill

customer_reviews.title: wraps nicely and after being on the tree a while
customer_reviews.text: wraps nicely and after being on the tree a while, still looks white! tree seems to be doing well a month later too
customer_reviews.author: crk

customer_reviews.title: go ahead...throw your money away
customer_reviews.text: You might as well throw your money in the trash and save the time it takes to order this. There is no way to keep it on the tree.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Very durable. Bought Ace Hardware "equivalent" which did not last more than a week. This one is very good. Do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: QYC

customer_reviews.title: Great wrap for damaged tree
customer_reviews.text: Received this item on time and it was exactly as listed on Amazon. Wrapped the damaged tree trunk and was amazed at the amount of wrap. Had enough to do another tree if needed.
customer_reviews.author: shopper gal

customer_reviews.title: Kobe’s Tree Wrap Does the Big Job!,,
customer_reviews.text: Did great job for us. Tree looks great, brought it back alive!
customer_reviews.author: ........Shirley  Butler

customer_reviews.title: Small trees need this.
customer_reviews.text: You really do need this on young (5" in diameter or less) trees, One year I didn't do it and the bark stripped on a 4" maple.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs some better engineering.
customer_reviews.text: Not as stretchy as advertised. Hard to tie off. I ended up splitting an end and tying a knot.
customer_reviews.author: Barton Brothers

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: Product as described, wrapped around my trees, and has stayed secure through several storms and a lot of rain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. One roll was enough to wrap ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. One roll was enough to wrap two trees of about 2" diameter 4' high.
customer_reviews.author: William Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Great anti varmit wrap
customer_reviews.text: This wrap is easy to use and covers a large area on each tree. The rabbits dislike it on the other hand!
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's good so far! We shall wait and see how it does this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret R Ellett

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: expensive for what it is and not very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Tree wrap saved my Tree!
customer_reviews.text: I have several new citrus trees that were struggling through the summer. Rabbits were nibbling on the spindly trunks. I bought this and the trees are doing great! It helped with the heat stress and keeps the nibblers away. I don't think my trees would have made it their first year without this.
customer_reviews.author: mycowboy

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought...
customer_reviews.text: For the price... I don't know. I just expected more product, I guess. It can't be very expensive to make so I thought that the roll was really rather skimpy. I know... it says it's 20 feet so I guess what I'm saying is that I used more than I thought I would to bind up 2 different saplings. It's a little early to determine if it will last through the winter weather.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tree Wrap
customer_reviews.text: Easily wrapped a young tree to about 6 feet. Product clings to self properly and stay on the trunk without binding or loosening. Wish it was a little longer for larger trees.
customer_reviews.author: Fat Leon

customer_reviews.title: Cicada proof your tree trunks
customer_reviews.text: Out here in the east coast, we will soon be bombarded with the 17 year cicada. They only last till mating and laying eggs for about a month, then die. I put the wrap on my young fruit trees and am pleased they now have the protection they require. I will most likely leave the wrap on the trunks through next spring. I would surely recommend this product to anyone saving their young trees.
customer_reviews.author: DigiSuper

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: two of the rolls were yellowed as if they had been stored too long
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to wrap on very small trees.
customer_reviews.text: Harder to wrap than expected. I assumed the wrap would stick to itself a bit better, but it really didn't. It's also not angled, so you wind up with bunched up spots in your wrap as you wind it up the tree. Three stars because it does seem to be protecting my young apple tree trunks from bunnies, but it wasn't easy and it isn't pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Elanor Rigby

customer_reviews.title: Great if you keep them away from goats!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I have to buy more because as it turns out, they do the job easily, but they are not goat proof. Guess goats like to eat this which is why I had to repair the trees in the first place. The trees I repaired that are away from goats have had this stuff on them without incident for months and month.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Great tree wrap
customer_reviews.text: Great tree wrap. This wrap has kept the critters from chewing the bark of my young trees during the winter months. Holds up well too.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Saved my apple trees
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what the heck was chewing up my young apple trees (rabbits?), but this wrap stopped them in their tracks. We planted our two trees in March. They were just sticks with roots from Home Depot. After a couple of months they bloomed with leaves and flowers. Then came the apples! Wow. Can't believe they produced fruit after only a couple of months in the ground here. Anyway, this tree protection wrap works. Go!
customer_reviews.author: D. McNally

customer_reviews.title: Young red maple protection
customer_reviews.text: I use this to winter protect young red maples that are planted on a slope with exposure to south and southwest wind. Also some critter likes to scratch on the trees, and the wrap provides some protection. I used this last year, but the nurseries did not have this conveniently available this year - thus the purchase from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: R. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Good tree protection from insects
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to put on and seemed to protect the tree trunk, but also put drain pipe around too
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to tie or tuck in place. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Twoundertwo

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great solution to keeping young tree trunks away from damage caused by weed whackers. I would buy it again too.
customer_reviews.author: Clare Sassoon

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: Not adhesive, thin, does not contorted well, would offer no protection in the commercial role it was purchasers for. A complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Wrap falls off the tree constantly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wrap because one of our kittens outside like to use the trees as his scratching post. All this did was give him something to play with after he tore it off and for me to clean up. I tried everything and every trick to keep it on short of glueing it to the tree.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

product_meta.title: Jobe’s Tree Wrap for Tree Trunk Protection (Reflects Heat and Provides Professional Protection from Insects) Stretches as Tree Grows, Wraps 3 to 4 Young Trees, 4 inches x 20 feet
product_meta.description:
Young trees are especially susceptible to bark splitting and scalding, which can attract insects and cause disease or sap loss. To safeguard your trees from these threats, Jobe’s TreeWrap reflects heat and acts as a barrier to insects and rodents. This patented material insulates while allowing the free exchange of air and water. Simply wrap the base of your tree in overlapping spirals. TreeWrap will stretch as the tree grows providing long-lasting protection. The roll is 4 inches wide with 20 feet of material.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Your young tree is especially susceptible to bark splitting and scalding, which can attract insects and cause disease or sap loss. To safeguard your tree from these threats, Jobe's TreeWrap reflects heat and acts as a barrier to insects and rodents. This patented material insulates while allowing the free exchange of air and water. Simply wrap the base of your tree in overlapping spirals. TreeWrap will stretch as the tree grows providing long lasting protection. The roll is 4 inches wide with 20 feet of material.
feature_bullets: Jobe's professional tree wrap protection; Wrap measures 4 inches wide and 20 feet long
Reflects heat and acts as a barrier to insects and rodents
Patented material insulates while allowing the free exchange of air and water
Simply wrap the base of your tree in overlapping spirals
TreeWrap will stretch as the tree grows providing long-lasting protection
Protects young trees from bark damage
